name: Side Split Squats Right
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your feet wide apart, facing to the right side.

2. Gradually bend one knee towards the ground, lowering your body until you're in a lunge position. Place your back foot (left foot) on the ground and keep it firm.
 
3. Keeping your spine straight and core engaged, bend the front leg (right leg) more than the back leg, while keeping weight evenly distributed between both legs.

4. Keep your arms extended for balance. Ensure to maintain proper posture throughout the exercise.

5. Push off the ground with the heel of your front foot and return to the starting position by straightening that leg.
short_summary: Side Split Squats are a unilateral lower body exercise targeting multiple muscle groups.
